result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on May 8, 2023 at 09:00 am.

11:38 AM Defendant Nanci L Kurland in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached an agreement.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment and approves the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 8, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Proposed Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Hearing on May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:22 AM Defendant Nanci L Kurland in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:58 AM Defendant Nanci L Kurland in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Hughes is appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
